title: Add a Windows application manifest
body:
## Feature Request

#### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
starship doesn't include a Windows application manifest, which triggers all sorts compatibility behavior by Windows which can possibly slow down process startup (And which, regrettably, don't seem to be well documented, at least I wasn't able to find a clear documentation of them).

#### Describe the solution you'd like
Just add a manifest with the wanted attributes. Sadly, this isn't yet handled by Rust automatically. (And even MSVC still doesn't have UI to add the `supportedOS` stuff, it only adds the UAC attribute).

#### Describe alternatives you've considered
It can also be included as a separate file next to the executable, but an embedded manifest is still cleaner IMHO.

In addition, we can consider if we need [activeCodePage](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/sbscs/application-manifests#activecodepage) and/or [longPathAware](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/sbscs/application-manifests#longPathAware). Though I think Rust stdio already handles console output encoding so `activeCodePage` might not have any effect, and `longPathAware` kinda depends on if the shell uses it or not for it to have any meaning. (It could be passing/using literal `\\?\` paths)

This can also be used to add `VERSIONINFO` but there might be an easier way to generate that. Or an icon, which isn't really important for a CLI app.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/sbscs/application-manifests
